# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    wrapped_text = ""
    words = split(text)

    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
        wrapped_text *= word * " "
    end

    return wrapped_text
end

example_wrap = wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines", 10))
println(example_wrap)
```

In this example, the `wrap_string` function takes a string and an optional text_width parameter. It wraps words that exceed the specified text_width by adding a new line. The example provided is for the given task with a text_width of 10.
